sen.j: 藤原 家保（ふじわら の いえやす、承暦4年（1080年） - 保延2年（1136年））は平安時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Ieyasu (1080-1136) was Kugyo (the top court officials) who lived in the latter part of the Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Ieyasu (1080 - 1136) was a Kugyo (court noble) who lived during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: changed "(the top court officials") to "(court noble)";fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Ieyasu (1080 - 1136) was a Kugyo (court noble) who lived during the late Heian period.

sen.j: 六条修理大夫藤原顕季の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of FUJIWARA no Akisue who was Rokujo Shuri no daibu (a master of building and construction of the Palace from Rokujo Fujiwara family).
He was the second son of FUJIWARA no Akisue who was the Rokujo Shuri no daibu (master in charge of construction on the palace from the Rokujo Fujiwara family).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: He was the second son of FUJIWARA no Akisue who was the Rokujo Shuri no daibu (master in charge of construction on the palace from the Rokujo Fujiwara family).

sen.j: 各国の受領を歴任し、長承3年（1134年）従三位参議に至る。
sen.e: He hold positions of Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) in various provinces and assigned to Sangi (councilor) of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1134.
Ieyasu held the position of Zuryo (head of the provincial governors) in various provinces, and in 1134 was assigned as a Sangi (councilor) with the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: changed position of year; changed "He" to "Ieyasu" since this is a new paragraph; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Ieyasu held the position of Zuryo (head of the provincial governors) in various provinces, and in 1134 was assigned as a Sangi (councilor) with the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 白河上皇院政期において比類なき信任を受け、白河院司受領、院庁別当を歴任。
sen.e: He was greatly confidenced during the insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor) of the retired Emperor Shirakawa, and held positions such as Shirakawainnotsukasa (an official of the office of retired Emperor Shirakawa) Zuryo and Innocho Betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office).

During the Insei period (period of government ruled by the retired Emperor), Emperor Shirakawa held great confidence in Ieyasu and he held such positions as Shirakawa-innotsukasa (an official within the Retired Emperor's office) and Innocho Betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office), along with his post of Zuryo.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Insei"; rearranged sentence to read more smoothly; added a hyphen in "Shirakawa-innotsukasa" to read easier; changed content in parenthesis to be more consistent; fixed grammar
sen.e: During the Insei period (period of government ruled by the Retired Emperor), Retired Emperor Shirakawa held great confidence in Ieyasu and he held such positions as Shirakawa-innotsukasa (an official within the Retired Emperor's office) and Innocho Betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office), along with his post of Zuryo.
sen.cmt: Retired Emperor Shirakawa としました。

sen.j: 家保の一家は、兄である藤原長実の系統を凌いで善勝寺流の嫡流の地位を占めるに至った。
sen.e: His family got the position of the main branch of Zenshoji-ryu (the Zenshoji lineage), overcoming the lineage of his brother FUJWIARA no Nagazane.
His family gained position as the main branch of Zenshoji-ryu (Zenshoji lineage), overcoming the lineage of his brother, FUJIWARA no Nagazane.
sen.cmt: FUJWIARA→FUJIWARA; changed "got the position of" to "gained position as"
sen.e: His family gained position as the main branch of Zenshoji-ryu (Zenshoji lineage), overcoming the lineage of his brother, FUJIWARA no Nagazane.

sen.j: 鳥羽上皇院政期にも引き続き重用され、没後に跡を継いだ嫡男の家成は、鳥羽院政の中心を担う存在となった。
sen.e: He was continuously treated preferentially in the insei period of the retired Emperor Toba and his legitimate son Ienari who succeeded him after Ieyasu's death played the central role in the Cloister government of Toba.

He continuously received preferential treatment during the Insei period of the retired Emperor Toba. Ieyasu's legitimate son and successor, Ienari, also played a central role within the Cloister Toba government.
sen.cmt: split into two sentences; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: He continuously received preferential treatment during the Insei period of the Retired Emperor Toba; Ieyasu's legitimate son and successor, Ienari, also played a central role within the cloister government by the Retired Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: 鳥羽院政→cloister government by the Retired Emperor Toba としました。

sen.j: その子孫は羽林家の四条家として現代に至るまで続いている。
sen.e: His descendants has lasted as the Shijo family of the House of Urin until now.
His descendants continue living today as the Shijo family of the House of Urin.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: His descendants continue living today as the Shijo family of the House of Urin.

sen.j: 受領時代に培った経済力を生かし、証金剛院など多くの堂塔の造営にも貢献した。
sen.e: Using the economic power which he gained while he was Zuryo, he contributed to building many doto (temple and pagoda) such as Shokongo-in.
Using the economic power Ieyasu gained while holding the post of Zuryo, he contributed to building many doto (temples and pagodas), such as the Shokongo-in.
sen.cmt: changed the first "he" to "Ieyasu"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Using the economic power Ieyasu gained while holding the post of Zuryo, he contributed to building many temples and pagodas, such as the Shokongo-in.
sen.cmt: 堂塔→temples and pagodas としました。

sen.j: 邸宅は三条東洞院（京都市中京区）にあったと伝わる。
sen.e: It is said that his residence was located at Sanjo Higashinotoin (Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City).
His residence was reportedly located at Sanjo Higashinotoin (Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: changed "It is said that" to "reportedly" and fixed grammar accoridingly
sen.e: His residence was reportedly located at Sanjo Higashinotoin (Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City).
